001package imagingbook.lib.image;
002
003import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
004import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
005import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
006import imagingbook.lib.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
007import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
008import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
009import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
010
011/**
012 * This class defines methods to perform arbitrary geometric transformations
013 * on images. The geometric transformation (mapping) must be specified at
014 * construction, optionally a pixel interpolation method can be specified.
015 * 
016 * The specified geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
017 * <strong>target to source</strong> coordinates!
018 * 
019 * @version 2021/08/27
020 *
021 */
022public class ImageMapper {
023        
024        /** Default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
025        public static OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NearestBorder;       
026        
027        /** Default pixel interpolation method (see {@link InterpolationMethod}). */
028        public static InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bicubic;     
029        
030        private final OutOfBoundsStrategy obs;
031        private final InterpolationMethod ipm;
032        private final Mapping2D mapping;
033        
034        /**
035         * Creates a new instance with the specified geometric mapping.
036         * The default pixel interpolation method is used
037         * (see {@link DefaultInterpolationMethod}).
038         * @param targetToSourceMapping the geometric mapping
039         */
040        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D targetToSourceMapping) {
041                this(targetToSourceMapping, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
042        }
043
044        /**
045         * Creates a new instance with the specified geometric mapping
046         * and pixel interpolation method.
047         * @param targetToSourceMapping the geometric mapping
048         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy (affects source image only)
049         * @param ipm the pixel interpolation method
050         */
051        public ImageMapper(Mapping2D targetToSourceMapping, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
052                this.mapping = targetToSourceMapping;
053                this.obs = obs;
054                this.ipm = ipm;
055        }
056        
057        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
058        
059        /**
060         * Destructively transforms the passed image using this geometric
061         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
062         * 
063         * @param ip target image to which this mapping is applied
064         */
065        public void map(ImageProcessor ip) {
066                // make a temporary copy of the image:
067                ImageProcessor source = ip.duplicate();
068                ImageProcessor target = ip;
069                map(source, target);
070                source = null;
071        }
072        
073        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
074        
075        /**
076         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
077         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method. Note that source
078         * and target must be different images!
079         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
080         * target to source image coordinates!
081         * 
082         * @param source input image (not modified)
083         * @param target output image (modified)
084         */
085        public void map(ImageProcessor source, ImageProcessor target) {
086                if (target == source) {
087                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
088                }
089                ImageAccessor sourceAcc = ImageAccessor.create(source, obs, ipm);
090                ImageAccessor targetAcc = ImageAccessor.create(target);
091                map(sourceAcc, targetAcc);
092        }
093
094        
095        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
096
097        /**
098         * Transforms the source image to the target image using this geometric
099         * mapping and the specified pixel interpolation method.
100         * The two images are passed as instances of {@link ImageAccessor}.
101         * Note that source and target reference different images!
102         * The geometric mapping is supposed to be INVERTED, i.e. transforming
103         * target to source image coordinates!
104         * 
105         * @param sourceAcc accessor to the source image
106         * @param targetAcc accessor to the target image
107         */
108        public void map(ImageAccessor sourceAcc, ImageAccessor targetAcc) {
109                if (targetAcc.getProcessor() == sourceAcc.getProcessor()) {
110                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Source and target image must not be the same!");
111                }
112                Mapping2D invMap = mapping;             // this always IS an inverse mapping!!
113                ImageProcessor target = targetAcc.getProcessor();
114                final int w = target.getWidth();
115                final int h = target.getHeight();
116                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
117                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
118                                Pnt2d sourcePt = invMap.applyTo(PntInt.from(u, v));
119                                float[] val = sourceAcc.getPix(sourcePt.getX(), sourcePt.getY());
120                                targetAcc.setPix(u, v, val);
121                        }
122                }
123        }
124
125}
